title: Trump Considers Overhaul of Refugee System That Would Favor White People
summary: The proposals would transform a program aimed at helping the most vulnerable people in the world into one that gives preference to mostly white people who say they are being persecuted.

title: Oval Office Becomes a Diorama of Power Dynamics as Trump Goes After Rivals
summary: Top officials, unwilling to fight for the historical independence of their institutions, watched on Wednesday as President Trump continued his pursuit of controlling law enforcement.

title: Trump Administration Decimates Birth Control Office in Layoffs
summary: The layoffs have raised fears that the administration could be effectively ending an initiative that provides contraception for millions of low-income women.

title: The Lonely House Republican Still Coming to Work During the Shutdown
summary: Representative Kevin Kiley of California has criticized his own party for keeping the House out of session during the shutdown. He is battling boredom and disaffection as the stalemate drags on.

title: Trump Administration Authorizes Covert C.I.A. Action in Venezuela
summary: The development comes as the U.S. military is drawing up options for President Trump to consider, including possible strikes inside the country.

title: Trump Helped Argentina Face an Economic Meltdown. It Came At a Cost.
summary: When President Javier Milei of Argentina faced an economic meltdown, President Trump vowed to come to his aid. But that lifeline is coming at a cost.

title: On Fox News, Mamdani Speaks Directly to Trump: I Won’t Be a Mayor Like Adams
summary: Zohran Mamdani, the Democratic nominee for New York City mayor, defended his positions while parrying questions about the Israel-Gaza war.

title: Trump Says $16 Billion Hudson River Tunnel Project Is ‘Terminated’
summary: It was not immediately clear what the president meant and whether the project, known as Gateway, had already been stripped of federal funding.

title: Malala Yousafzai Thought She’d Never Fall in Love
summary: The global activist gets candid in her new memoir. She spoke with us about struggling with panic attacks, finding her personal style and changing her mind about what marriage could be.

title: With Tariff Threat and Trade Controls, China and U.S. Renew Game of Chicken
summary: Xi Jinping’s need to project strength before a crucial meeting of Communist Party leaders may help explain why Beijing announced new rare earth controls.

title: Hamas Says It Has Returned All Hostage Remains It Can Recover
summary: The militants said they would need special equipment to retrieve more bodies in Gaza. The announcement could put the truce with Israel at risk.

title: With Truce in Place, Hamas Pursues Bloody Crackdown on Rivals in Gaza
summary: A video this week captured Hamas fighters in Gaza executing Palestinian rivals as the militant group tries to assert that it is still the dominant force in the territory after two years of war with Israel.

title: What Happens When Claudia Conway, Maddie Block and Children of Politicians Speak Out
summary: The conversation heats up on social media.

title: Motherhood Is in a Political Spotlight, but the Moms Are Shaking It Off
summary: Guidance and messaging on parenting has never seemed more confusing to some. At a gathering for mothers, the point was to focus on what they had in common.

title: Republicans Face Fallout From Racist and Homophobic Texts
summary: Some local G.O.P. officials who participated in the text exchanges are losing their jobs or being pressured to resign. But top Republicans have been dismissive.

title: 40 Years After ‘The Goonies,’ Fans Still Flock to Astoria, Oregon
summary: Astoria, Ore., the setting of the classic 1985 teen movie, invites fans to follow their inner adventurer and explore a scenic corner of the Northwest.

title: Gavin Newsom Vetoes Reparations Bills in California
summary: Gov. Gavin Newsom of California vetoed bills that would have provided tangible benefits to those descendants, though he approved a state agency to determine who qualifies for potential reparations.

title: Derek Rose, Impeccable Purveyor of Luxury Pajamas, Dies at 93
summary: His colorful men’s nightwear was like something made on Savile Row in London — perfect, pricey — except that it was rarely seen outside the bedroom.

title: In the Middle East, It’s Right Vs. Right
summary: Who would have imagined I’d ever praise something Trump did in the world of foreign policy?

title: How Afraid of the A.I. Apocalypse Should We Be?
summary: The researcher Eliezer Yudkowsky argues that we should be very afraid of artificial intelligence’s existential risks.

title: Denmark’s Renewable Energy Prospects Dim Under the Trump Administration
summary: Orsted, a Danish wind farm developer, has been hammered by high costs and President Trump’s efforts to stymie renewable energy. Its struggles are rippling across Denmark.

title: N.Y. Democrats Urge Hochul to Reject Pipeline Over Climate Concerns
summary: Ten members of Congress wrote in a letter to the governor that a gas pipeline proposed for New York Harbor runs counter to the state’s emissions reductions goals.

title: American Flag With Swastika Is Found in Republican Congressman’s Office
summary: Representative Dave Taylor of Ohio condemned the symbol as “vile” and said his office was investigating with the U.S. Capitol Police.
